Thought it was my phone or it's camera, but it's not.

Content: Hello, if you're having trouble trying to quickly scan your 'qr code' and It isn't scanning fast enough, it isn't the app's fault it's usually the 'older the phones' fault. Simply because 'older phones' aren't usually capable to scan 'qr codes' if there's 'sunlight' blocking it's view, the camera's blurry, or even it's lagging cause the device can't handle scanning and popping up the 'all goods to go' site. This is because your camera's on the older phone isn't advanced than today's.

Content: Doesn't run without Google Spyware Framework. Contains analytics from both google and microsoft. Content: Review updated following release of version 3.0.2. Still not fixed;ââ¢ "Checking exposure keys" continuously displayed (but see below)ââ¢ Bluetooth connectivity. Even when Bluetooth is enabled the app fails to use Bluetoothââ¢ Slow start-up time. Perhaps spend time fixing the Bluetooth functionality rather than spending the time claiming to the media that it works. Just look at all of the app reviews here saying the Bluetooth capability does not work. Workaround for (a): #1 Close app. Turn off Bluetooth. #2 Turn on Bluetooth, open app. #3 Click "Dashboard" and the "Bluetooth Tracing could not be activated". #4. Wait some (up to a minute) #5. "Checking exposure keys" notification should disappear. #6 exit app, turn off Bluetooth. #7 If #6 does not work, repeat steps #1 through #4 a second time.

Content: App is more difficult if sites put posters behind glass. Glare & reflections make scanning difficult. Having extra posters means the App will is much more usable. If the QR poster in direct sunlight behind glass just repositioning the phone helps in triggering QR detection/read in the App. However requiring the sites to put a copy of the QR poster inside, shielded from sun and NOT behind glass is a far better solution than requiring the App users to "Just wiggle it a bit and try a different angle!" This simple fix where implemented has greatly improved the usability of the app for all users.
final_text: app difficult sites put posters behind glass glare reflections make scanning difficult extra posters means app much usable qr poster direct sunlight behind glass repositioning phone helps triggering qr detection read app however requiring sites put copy qr poster inside shielded sun behind glass far better solution requiring app users quot wiggle bit try different angle quot simple fix implemented greatly improved usability app users

Content: To clarify my earlier comment: Incomplete and therefore not very useful. Incomplete because QR codes are not everywhere like at people's homes, parties, public places or wherever it's possible to get the virus. Furthermore the user must be vigilant and remember to scan which realistically is often not going to happen. This app needs an optional GPS based continuous recording of location (optional to not frighten away paranoid people) which would provide much better contact tracing info.
final_text: clarify earlier comment incomplete therefore useful incomplete qr codes everywhere like people homes parties public places wherever possible get virus furthermore user must vigilant remember scan realistically often going happen app needs optional gps based continuous recording location optional frighten away paranoid people would provide much better contact tracing info

Content: This app is designed to aid the ministry of health with contact tracing. If you try using this scanner on a QR code at a metlink bus stop, it will probably not work. This is because the bus stop has a QR code designed to take you to a metlink webpage which is not the type of QR code this app uses. If a QR code does not work with this app, try using a generic QR code scanner. Not all QR codes are compatible with this app so you will need to manually record your visit when that happens.
final_text: app designed aid ministry health contact tracing try using scanner qr code metlink bus stop probably work bus stop qr code designed take metlink webpage type qr code app uses qr code work app try using generic qr code scanner qr codes compatible app need manually record visit happens

Content: Too many requirements. Why do I have to sign-up for an account? Why do you have to store any information about me? Why can't I just use it as a local register on my own phone that I can refer back to as & when needed? It could still download a daily list of 'at risk' QR sites to do a local comparison and warn if any places I'd scanned were on the danger lists. So I jumped through your password rules hoops (why?) then I had to enter a pin sent to my email - only I was signing up on my phone and I don't have email on my phone! So it's not easy to just install and start using offline. They're pretty standard requirements I know but if you want buy-in you need to make it as simple and easy as possible. If people want to volunteer more info, let them. If they don't, you should still let people install and use it offline. There's no reason QR codes and manual entries can't be logged without an email/password logon. Also, the app isn't even available for so many phones. Two of my immediate family members are using older, but still very capable flagship Galaxy S phones - app not compatible.
final_text: many requirements sign account store information use local register phone refer back needed could still download daily list risk qr sites local comparison warn places would scanned danger lists jumped password rules hoops enter pin sent email signing phone email phone easy install start using offline pretty standard requirements know want buy need make simple easy possible people want volunteer info let still let people install use offline reason qr codes manual entries logged without email password logon also app even available many phones two immediate family members using older still capable flagship galaxy phones app compatible

Content: Updated Review 3rd Aug Fantastic to see the app now supports the older Android version my phone has (6.0). Furthermore manual entries can now be added where a location does not have a bar code and also notification of when I visit somewhere where someone tested positive. I will upgrade to 5 stars when I hear someone being notified via the app of a positive test of someone who visited the same location as myself. Well done MoH on the updates, communications and esp. my request to support older Android versions than v7.0 Original Review (was 2 stars) Does not supports Android 6.0 but did on initial launch now I cannot upgrade and its unreliable. Very disappointing that an app such as this does not support Android 6 (or even older), the whole idea is to get as many people as possible using this app. Even Google, MS and RSA support Android 6 for secure use such as auth apps. Note I cannot upgrade my Android version as Huawei don't make it available here.I suggest that is requirement. for the next release. I'll upgrade my review when I saw better Android OS support

Content: I've used this app successfully, but every so often it tells me to log in again with my email and password. Why? Obviously I'm not going to do that in a queue with people waiting for me! Content:
Towards the start of the August delta outbreak I noticed I had been at a location of interest from media reports 13 days prior. 

I checked the app and sure enough I scanned at the location inside the time period when a positive case was at that location. 

When talking to public health officers I raised the issue of lack of BT notifications or the app itself failing to notify me of a location match. I was told that BT is not being used (so why am I wasting my phone battery allowing BT access to the app?) and could not get a straight answer about the lack of notification about the place of interest. 

This app is nothing more than a stupid diary.
final_text: towards start august delta outbreak noticed location interest media reports days prior checked app sure enough scanned location inside time period positive case location talking public health officers raised issue lack bt notifications app failing notify location match told bt used wasting phone battery allowing bt access app could get straight answer lack notification place interest app nothing stupid diary

Content:
The app is easy to use and has grown a lot since April last year. Despite all the plusses of using QR codes, I still to this day find it annoying that every time I need to sign-in, I need to take my phone out, get the lighting right, scan the huge yellow poster, press âDoneâ then turn it off. Trust me, it gets pretty tedious after 50 or so scans. 

It might be even better if NFC âpebblesâ could be stuck to surfaces and we could just tap our phones to them. *Satisfying Apple Pay sound effect plays!* This could be another (potentially easier) option for businesses to use if multiple people are crowding around one single poster in a supermarket or shopping centre. Maybe there could be a subway-like system where you go in to a shop and tap your phone on the counter? Anyway, itâs just an idea.

Apart from that, itâs a nice app to use and should be being used in these times.
final_text: app easy use grown lot since april last year despite plusses using qr codes still day find annoying every time need sign need take phone get lighting right scan huge yellow poster press done turn trust gets pretty tedious scans might even better nfc pebbles could stuck surfaces could tap phones satisfying apple pay sound effect plays could another potentially easier option businesses use multiple people crowding around one single poster supermarket shopping centre maybe could subway like system go shop tap phone counter anyway idea apart nice app use used times

Content:
It will not download onto my phone - Samsung Galaxy J1 (2016). Have been checking for a long time. Not everyone can have the latest phone.

Had to put it on my iPod, so the Bluetooth function will not work as it relies on Wifi/data. It scans and keeps a record with no problems, although I often wonder if I would even get a notification if I needed it.

I have never received the change of levels alert.

Bought my 80yr old mother a new ph so she could use the app as it wouldnât work on her old phone either which I think she only bought last yr as it was an easier ph fr her to use. She can now scan in, but she cannot use the Bluetooth function either as it relies on Data being on.

She has had to turn data off because she is a prepaid pay as you go user and it was running through too much credit to use data.

My brother doesnât use data either for the same reason.

My husband is the only user out of all 7 people (5 in my household & my mother & brother) that is able to have the app fully functioning on his phone. It is his work phone - an iPhone but he will lose that next week when he changes jobs.

There is a big gap with users that either canât use it or it wonât function properly as it relies on having the ârightâ phone and user data/wifi being on constantly.

There should be an additional text message alert for these users, should be available to more phones, and would be good if the Bluetooth function did not rely on wifi/data.
final_text: download onto phone samsung galaxy j checking long time everyone latest phone put ipod bluetooth function work relies wifi data scans keeps record problems although often wonder would even get notification needed never received change levels alert bought yr old mother new ph could use app work old phone either think bought last yr easier ph fr use scan cannot use bluetooth function either relies data turn data prepaid pay go user running much credit use data brother use data either reason husband user people household mother brother able app fully functioning phone work phone iphone lose next week changes jobs big gap users either use function properly relies right phone user data wifi constantly additional text message alert users available phones would good bluetooth function rely wifi data

Content:
Request:
Addition of turning on the flash in lowlight situations; I catch the bus when itâs still dark and Iâve got a 50% chance of it scanning in the dark, even when the driver turns on the lights.

Original Review:
Hey,
Good on you for getting out an app so quickly under such time and privacy constraints, across two device platforms. 

Iâm not personally 100% keen on the email and password data being hosted in Sydney on an AWS server, especially in a govt project, but as youâve gone to the trouble of ensuring other data is both optional and locally kept, itâs an ease of implementation sacrifice Iâll live with.
 
Congratulations to this team, and I hope all of you get to stay home - and maybe enjoy a bit of a well-earned break!
final_text: request addition turning flash lowlight situations catch bus still dark got chance scanning dark even driver turns lights original review hey good getting app quickly time privacy constraints across two device platforms personally keen email password data hosted sydney aws server especially govt project gone trouble ensuring data optional locally kept ease implementation sacrifice live congratulations team hope get stay home maybe enjoy bit well earned break

Content:
Overall, I have liked the ease of the COVID tracer app. Updates have seen the tracking gone from 30 to 60 days, and more businesses have included the QR codeâs to sign in. Manually being able to enter has also been great. 

One of the things which would be great is to have the diary link to the account rather than the phone. This would help with people who have both a work and personal phone, so that they can see where they were easier rather than looking at both diaries to work it out. 

The second is that while the app is compatible with most phones, I have had no luck in getting a manual or automatic diary entry to work on the iPhone 11. I can see there were issues a few months ago, however, the recommendations to redownload the app and restart the phone have been unsuccessful. This means that two phones need to be carried to sign in, and this is not always feasible. With many places refusing entry unless you sign in to the app, it makes it quite limiting when it does not work. Having the app so it is compatible on all devices would be great.
final_text: overall liked ease covid tracer app updates seen tracking gone days businesses included qr code sign manually able enter also great one things would great diary link account rather phone would help people work personal phone see easier rather looking diaries work second app compatible phones luck getting manual automatic diary entry work iphone see issues months ago however recommendations redownload app restart phone unsuccessful means two phones need carried sign always feasible many places refusing entry unless sign app makes quite limiting work app compatible devices would great

Content:
The COVID tracer app is a vital part of our response to COVID-19, but it only work when people actually use it.

As weâve moved back down the alert level, I have seen fewer people scan the codes on their way into businesses. Also, there are times when interactions with the public cannot be recorded (e.g. parks).

Adding Bluetooth technology (such as the privacy-focused API co-developed by Apple and Google) will remove any friction from using the app and will greatly improve its effectiveness.

Now is a great opportunity to add this feature as we prepare ourselves for any future outbreaks.
final_text: covid tracer app vital part response covid work people actually use moved back alert level seen fewer people scan codes way businesses also times interactions public cannot recorded e g parks adding bluetooth technology privacy focused api co developed apple google remove friction using app greatly improve effectiveness great opportunity add feature prepare future outbreaks

Content:
Look, we are all learning as we go here, and this app is evolving as well. Letâs get on board and provide as much constructive feedback as we can. 

The update which provides the ability to add details helps greatly. You can add whatever info you want, and even create detailed manual entries. You can make a note as to whether you visited Bunnings for 5 minutes to grab a bag of potting mix and go, or spent an hour browsing the aisles. You can even note if you saw Karen if you were wearing a mask. 

Iâd still like to see a check out option, but can use the edit details function as a work around.
final_text: look learning go app evolving well let get board provide much constructive feedback update provides ability add details helps greatly add whatever info want even create detailed manual entries make note whether visited bunnings minutes grab bag potting mix go spent hour browsing aisles even note saw karen wearing mask still like see check option use edit details function work around

Content:
There is a systemic issue with storing visits on many iPhones. Yesterday I tried all day to scan the QR codeâs but an error message appeared stating unable to record visit. This also happened when I tried to do a manual entry.

Calling the help line said they have an issue with iPhones and the app will hopefully be updated soon.

Itâs been 24hrs+ and still no updates! This is not good enough with the current level 3 in Auckland and moving to level 2 on Monday. Traceability is key especially if another cluster appears during level 2. As more and more people are starting to use the app you will lose them quickly.

Update: I reinstalled the app and this corrected the issue.
final_text: systemic issue storing visits many iphones yesterday tried day scan qr code error message appeared stating unable record visit also happened tried manual entry calling help line said issue iphones app hopefully updated soon hrs still updates good enough current level auckland moving level monday traceability key especially another cluster appears level people starting use app lose quickly update reinstalled app corrected issue

Content:
The app shouldnt be this hard to use. Apparently I have already signed up but when I try and reset my password this account doesnât exist. Joke of an app.

Resolved the above issue. Donât ask me what I did but after spending about 30 minutes trying to create an account/reset password I gave up. Then had a final crack the next day. A out of nowhere it accepted me email address to create an account. 

But out of no where after working for a while and scanning codes reliably, now it flat out doesnât work. Throws an error every time. Login log out doesnât resolve. For a contact tracing app that the govt is relying on for accurate information for a pandemic and controlling the spread, the nicest thing I can say about it is itâs unreliable. Fragments of data are worthless. Miss one contact and we could have another cluster. If it doesnât work it shouldnât be the one we are relying on.
final_text: app shouldnt hard use apparently already signed try reset password account exist joke app resolved issue ask spending minutes trying create account reset password gave final crack next day nowhere accepted email address create account working scanning codes reliably flat work throws error every time login log resolve contact tracing app govt relying accurate information pandemic controlling spread nicest thing say unreliable fragments data worthless miss one contact could another cluster work one relying
